title: Synthetic Recap
body:
**Heat Edge Cavaliers in Defensive Grinder as Hardaway Erupts for Historic 38**

CLEVELAND (AP) – In a defensive battle where points were a precious commodity, Tim Hardaway authored a masterpiece of individual offense that defied the very nature of the game. While the Miami Heat and Cleveland Cavaliers combined for a paltry 150 points in a 76-74 Heat victory, Hardaway’s singular, explosive performance was a supernova in a contest of grinding half-court sets.

The final score suggests a low-scoring affair, and for 11 players on the floor, it was. But for Hardaway, it was a historic clinic. The Heat guard poured in a staggering 38 points, single-handedly accounting for half of his team’s entire offensive output. On a night where his teammates collectively managed just 38 points, Hardaway’s scoring was not just vital; it was the entire foundation of the Miami win.

Every possession was a testament to his will. He slashed to the basket, hit pull-up jumpers, and drained clutch free throws, carrying an offense that often stalled without his direct involvement. The Cavaliers, led by 15 points from Chris Mills and a 14-point, 17-rebound double-double from Shawn Kemp, had no answer. They traded baskets and defensive stops, but they had no counter for the one-man scoring machine in a Heat uniform.

In the final, tense moments, with the game hanging in the balance, it was Hardaway’s relentless attack that sealed the deal. His performance transcended a mere win; it was a testament to individual brilliance overcoming collective struggle. On a night defined by defense, Tim Hardaway’s 38-point eruption was the only offense that truly mattered, delivering a hard-fought road victory in a game that will be remembered for one man’s unforgettable dominance.
